0.muscle_description: The one-arm dumbbell rowing on a flat or slightly inclined bench is a simple version of the dumbbell or barbell . The advantage is that you support yourself with your knee and arm on a bench to give more stability .
0.exercise_execution: As you exhale, pull the dumbbell back up with the latissimus . Concentrate on the movement of your elbow . It should be brought up as close to the body as possible .

1.muscle_description: Lying back stretching, also called Superman exercise, is a classic back exercise . The target muscles of this exercise are the two back extensions (musculus erector spinae), which run on both sides of the spine . The buttocks are also exercised in a not insignificant way, more precisely the large gluteus maximus muscle .
1.exercise_execution: Lift your right arm and left leg outstretched upwards as much as possible . Hold the tension at the highest point for a few seconds and then lower your arm and leg back down again . Repeat the exercise with the other arm .

2.muscle_description: In many gyms, there is a pull tower with rowing station on the cable pull towers or separately . It is a deep block in front of which a comparatively deep flat bench with inclined foot rest is attached . Here, the back muscles can be trained with different grip pieces .
2.exercise_execution: You now exhale and, while doing so, pull the handle over the elbows at the level of the lower chest backwards . Make sure that the elbow joints are pushed as close to the torso as possible . At the end of this movement, you try to squeeze the shoulder blades as far back .

3.muscle_description: Some bodybuilding professionals swear by this exercise as it is said to be the most effective biceps exercise for quick mass building . A few decades ago, the so-called drag curls were a popular exercise .
3.exercise_execution: Your lower back forms a slight hollow back (to relieve the intervertebral discs), your shoulders are behind and your chest extends forward . Your arms are almost completely stretched downwards, only a small bend in the elbow joint ensures that you protect the elbows .

4.muscle_description: You can simply do the Scottcurls on an incline bench and a dumbbell . Even if your gym does not have a Scott bench, you do not have to do without .
4.exercise_execution: In order to keep the upper body upright despite the low height of the pad, you go with your legs in a static step . The lower back forms a slight hollow back; this protects your intervertebral discs . Do not stretch the arm completely, but keep it slightly bent .

5.muscle_description: The concentrated arm curl is often seen in films but rarely seen in the studio . This is probably due to the fact that it is done alternately, i.e. each arm is trained individually . By supporting the elbow on the thigh, a swing with the upper arm and the shoulder is almost impossible .
5.exercise_execution: As you exhale, bend your arm upwards as much as you can so that you can see your fist from the front . Then slowly lower your forearm again as you inhale . Make sure that your arm is not fully stretched out at the end, but still has a slight bend in the elbow joint .

6.muscle_description: If you have a negative bench without a barbell holder at your gym, you can train your lower chest in addition to different abdominal exercises . It requires a lot of body control and strength to get to the starting position and to leave the negative bench after the exercise .
6.exercise_execution: It's not the first time he's been spotted out and about in Los Angeles in recent weeks .

7.muscle_description: Negative Bench Press exercise trains the large pectoral muscle . The negative cushioning position trains the lower muscle fibres .
7.exercise_execution: It's not the first time he's been spotted out and about in Los Angeles in recent weeks .

8.muscle_description: Not all studios have an incline bench in the barbell, this exercise has become a classic . The focus of this exercise is on training the collarbone fibres of the large pectoral muscle .
8.exercise_execution: If you put the dumbbells on your thighs with one side of the plates, you can raise them slightly to chest level by a successive upward movement of the thighs . Arms are bent and the forearms point vertically upwards . As you exhale, you extend your arms upwards .

9.muscle_description: One of the most effective exercises for the triceps (musculus triceps brachii) is triceps press on the cable pull . However, the long head of the . triceps is subject to comparatively little stress, which is why this exercise should be done in combination with another .
9.exercise_execution: Your elbows remain permanently in the same position, as only your forearms move . Afterwards, you let the grip piece slowly and controlled by the force of the pull rope back up . As you do so, you breathe in and exhale .

10.exercise_title: One-arm triceps press while lying down
10.muscle_description: A very rare triceps exercise is the lying triceps press with only one dumbbell . This exercise mainly demands the three heads of the triceps and the cartilage muscle .
10.exercise_execution: You start the exercise by controlling the dumbbell during your inhalation and lowering it slowly towards the opposite side of the body . If the upper arm and forearm have reached an angle of 90 degrees, you have reached the end point of this movement phase .

11.muscle_description: Dumbbell forehead press is the variant of the triceps exercise forehead press with a pair of dumbbells instead of the barbell bar . This exercise is also known as the French Press, Nose Breaker, and Skull Crusher .
11.exercise_execution: You start the exercise by slowly and controllably bending the dumbbells towards the head while exhaling . Your upper arms remain completely motionless, only your forearms show a visible movement . Afterwards, exhal, exhale, extend your arms vertically upwards .

12.exercise_title: Donkey Calf Raise at the Multi Press
12.muscle_description: Most German gyms do not have Donkey-Calf-Raise device . If you want the pressure on the pelvis to come from above, create similar conditions on the rack or on the multi-press .
12.exercise_execution: It's not the first time he's been spotted out and about in Los Angeles in recent weeks .

13.exercise_title: Vertical calf lift on the multi-press
13.muscle_description: Calf lifting while standing on the multi-press is especially suitable for gyms where there is no equipment of its own . This version is much safer to do and therefore preferable due to the securing possibilities and the guide rail .
13.exercise_execution: It's not the first time he's been spotted out and about in Los Angeles in recent weeks .

14.muscle_description: The popular shoulder exercise side lifting can also be easily copied with the Theraband . The Theraband is an easy-to-copied version of the popular shoulder exercises .
14.exercise_execution: Stand on the middle of the Thera band and grab the band so low that you keep a good tension with the band between your feet and arms almost fully stretched downwards . It is up to you to hold the fists in hammer position or in the upper grip .

15.muscle_description: Barbell front lifting is a common exercise for strengthening the front shoulder region (musculus deltoideus pars clavicularis)
15.exercise_execution: Your gaze is straight, your abdominal muscles are tensed and your lower back is slightly in the hollow back to relieve the intervertebral discs to the maximum . Your arms are not fully stretched during the exercise, but slightly bent in the elbow .

16.muscle_description: Standing shoulder press, also known as military press, is considered one of the oldest fitness exercises . When done standing up, shoulder press exercises not only your shoulders and triceps, but also your trunk muscles . The trunk muscles stabilize your body during the exercise and help balance the weight .
16.exercise_execution: Ideally, you do the Military Press on a squat stand or barbell rack . If you are doing the exercise for the first time, it makes sense not to load the bar with weight at first, but to work with an empty barbell .

17.exercise_title: Reverse flys on the cable pull
17.muscle_description: The reverse flys are an exercise not infrequently observed in the fitness center . The exercise mainly trains the rear shoulder area and the neck .
17.exercise_execution: As you exhale, slowly bring your almost outstretched arms parallel to the floor . As you inhale, bring your arms forward again until they cross again . Make sure that your entire body, with the exception of the shoulder and neck muscles, remains rigid and unchanged .
